title: Letters to the Editor:  Apple's New Passkeys Could  Make Estate Settling Harder
text:
While Apple Inc.'s passkeys are an interesting innovation in online security, they fail to address an important problem ("Apple Wants to End Passwords -- Here's How It Would Work" Personal Journal, June 13).

When my brother died, we were unable to access his bank accounts, life insurance or health records because his passwords were secured by a password manager to which he had left no one the master password. I've subsequently adopted a password manager and given my sister access to the safe-deposit box where my master password is stored. How will biometric-based passkeys allow for access after death? Managing someone's estate is already complicated, and this could complicate that task.

Stephen Klein

Spinnerstown, Pa.
